title-group.article-title: Roots of Two Transcendental Equations Determining the Frequency Spectra of Standing Spherical Electromagnetic Waves

abstract.p: Roots of the transcendental equations $$\frac{j_l(\lambda)}{y_1(\lambda)} = \frac{j_1(\alpha \lambda) \frac{i_{l-1}(\alpha \lambda\sqrt{|\epsilon|})} {i_1(\alpha \lambda \sqrt{|\epsilon|})} - \frac{1}{\sqrt}{|\epsilon|}} j_{l-1}(\alpha \lambda)}{y_l(\alpha \lambda) \frac{i_{l-1}(\alpha \lambda \sqrt{|\espilon|})}{i_l(\alpha \lambda \sqrt{|\psilon|})} - \frac{1}{\sqrt{|\epsilon|}} y_{l-1}(\alpha \lambda)}$$ and $$\frac{\eta j_{l-1}(\eta) - lj_l(\eta)}{\eta y_{l-1}(\eta) - ly_l(\eta)} = \frac{\frac{|\epsilon|}{1 + |\epsilon|} \alpha \eta jj_{l-1}(\alpha \eta) - lj_l(\alpha \eta) + \frac{\sqrt|\epsilon|}{1 + |\epsilon|} \alpha \eta j_l(\alpha \eta) \frac{i_{l-1}(\alpha \eta \sqrt{|\epsilon|)}}{i_l(\alpha \eta \sqrt{|\epsilon|)}}}{\frac{|\epsilon|}{1 + |\epsilon|}} \alpha \eta y_{l-1}(\alpha \eta) - ly_l(\alpha \eta) + \frac{\sqrt{|\epsilon|}}{1 + |\epsilon|}} \alpha \eta y_l(\alpha \eta) \frac{i_{l-1}(\alpha \eta \sqrt{|\epsilon|)}{i_l(\alpha \eta \sqrt{|\epsilon|)}}}$$ for the spherical Bessel functions of the first and the second kind, $j_l(x)$ and $y_l(x)$, and for the modified spherical Bessel functions of the first kind, $i_l(x)$, have been computed. The ranges for the parameters $\sqrt{|\epsilon|)}$ and $\alpha$, the order $l$ and the root index $n$ are: $$\sqrt{|\epsilon| = 1.0, 10.0, 100.0, 500.0;\quad \alpha = 0.1(0.1)0.7; l = 1(1)15; n = 1(1)30.$$
